meanings.definition: A sudden, quick disappearance or vanishing.
meanings.sent1: With a poof, the magician made the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent2: The smoke vanished with a poof.
meanings.sent3: The cake was there one moment, and poof, it was gone!
meanings.sent4: The dream of becoming a famous singer disappeared in a poof of smoke.
meanings.sent5: The snowman melted into a poof of white fluff.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to represent a sudden burst or explosion.
meanings.sent2: Poof! The dust flew into the air.
meanings.sent3: Poof! The bubble burst in a shower of soap.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks lit up the sky with a poof of colors.
meanings.sent5: The magician waved his wand, and poof, a dove appeared.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a homosexual man.
meanings.sent1: He was called a poof by some unkind people.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends accepted the new member, even though he was a poof.
meanings.sent3: The teasing stopped when they realized calling him a poof hurt his feelings.
meanings.sent4: In the old movie, the villain was portrayed as a sneaky poof.
meanings.sent5: The character in the play was proud to be a poof and stood up for his rights.
